title: In 314 bc, King Kuai of Yan 燕王噲 (r. 320-314) resigned in favour of his minister Zi Zhi 子 之. The leaders of the various states generally condemned his move as an acute violation of political propriety. The ruler of Zhongshan 中山 used this incident to invade Yan and conquer part of its territory, as recorded in a bronze vessel inscription
Yao and Shun abdicated; the kings of Xia, Yin and Zhou, so this passage, were succeeded by sons
